alert.note: Alert for Anchorage (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 23 at 4:22AM AKST until February 23 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow and rain expected. Total snow accumulations around 2 inches in town and 6 to 10 inches at higher elevations. Winds gusting as high as 25 mph in town and 40 mph at higher elevations. * WHERE...Anchorage. * WHEN...From 3 AM to 9 PM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and afternoon commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Periods of snow will mix with rain this morning and afternoon as southeast winds develop over town. The winds will diminish by late afternoon turning precipitation back to all snow. Higher elevations will see more snow than in the Anchorage bowl and the snow and wind at higher elevations may limit visibility at times. There remains a chance the southeast winds will not be sufficient to turn the snow to rain, which would increase snow amounts over the Anchorage Bowl.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
